channel.title: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)
channel.description:
Hi all,
with the release of Ubuntu mobile OS coming out for the Galaxy Nexus phone next month, it is a full linux OS on your mobile phone, with a new Unity mobile interface. Since this means our phones will be able to run any linux software that has been compiled to support ARM devices, i hear Java can be compiled to support ARM devices?
if so, we could have RSC/RS2 clients running on our smartphones very soon, obviously will need a little client-side rewriting to fit a phone a little better, what do you guys think about this?

item.title: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:11, topic:479757”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=597992.msg4214506#msg4214506 date=1360035456]

if so, we could have RSC/RS2 clients running on our smartphones very soon

That couldn’t be good for your battery.

Playing games on battery powered devices has never been good on the battery lol
[/quote]

this is true, but i would think this would be especially bad[/quote]
Shouldn’t be to much worse than Asphalt 7 or Pocket Legends.

Read full topic

item.title: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Guarantee I could get the old rs194 client working on my droid. Modern phones are fully capable of running the software engine. If you want to spend a little time, you could even get the 508 to work probably, given that gles20 is fully functional for anything Jagex uses as far as hardware acceleration goes.

Read full topic
item.source: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)

item.title: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

+1 for Ubuntu on phone. Looks really great from video previews thus far and I’m sure there’ll be a lot of cool shit for it.

Read full topic
item.source: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)

item.title: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

It would be awesome. As long as it’s not any slower than it is on computers (ignoring the CPU limitations), it should be fine. Many years ago when RuneScape didn’t suck I was running it perfectly on a 533MHz machine with 512MB RAM, so I don’t see a problem with it on phones. Then again, this was before RuneScape became the pile of shit it is today.

Read full topic
item.source: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)

item.title: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Java is already compiled for ARM. I have an android tablet that already dual boots ubuntu. Problem is that its not very fast yet. I’d need to have a look at the mobile window manager but scroll bars on regular one are not really usable on touch screen.

Read full topic
item.source: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)

item.title: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

xEnt:

raspberry pi is too slow for RS. a low end single core 800mhz no thx. look at nexus 4 etc with quad cores, 2gb ram and decent gpu

For the current client yes, older ones may have a struggling chance. The next thing to wonder is what kind of limitations you’ll have when the phone isn’t docked. From what I understand you wont gain full usability when its being used as a phone

Read full topic
item.source: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)

item.title: Java on ARM devices (RS on smartphones)
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

As long as it uses the soft float abi there should be no problem with the JVM. And assuming the host system has decent enough specs to run the damn memory whore. The Raspberry Pi has been an almost viable option for a little while now

Read full topic
